title: Indian banks may see loan-to-deposit ratios improve after fiscal Q1 rise
description: Indian banks' loan-to-deposit ratios are expected to improve after most reported increases in the Aprilâ€“June quarter. Deposit growth has slowed, with savings moving toward mutual funds and real estate. Analysts believe the higher LDR is a cyclical phenomenon and not a systemic concern, with expectations of normalization as government spending increases.
